translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The government once again reiterates to Your Lordship, by circular dated the 22nd of last month, which was addressed to you on the same date, and recommends that you most positively order the police commanders of your department to never allow any individual, whoever they may be, to pass through without being equipped with the appropriate passport, under the most severe responsibility, which Your Lordship

May God keep Your Lordship  
Caçapava, March 6, 1840  
Most Illustrious Sir  
Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Official letter from the Most Excellent, March 6, received on the 20th of the same month.

Secretary of the Republic  
To citizen Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, General Police Commander of the Boqueirão department.  
From the Ministry of War.  
Caçapava

Stamp on
